Articles.Content: At right here in video shooing the rollout of the Proton that launched TGO, why does the fairing look all soft and such?

This is not the fairing, it is a protective soft cover for the actual fairing. It is used only for the rollout.

Before launch

After launch
I was going to say, that would have been strange. I watched a few videos of launch but they were all so grainy I thought nothing had changed, but pretty clear from that picture there.
In the video I saw they said it was basically an air conditioning system. I guess that with the sun beating down, the interior of the fairing would get too hot for the payload's like.

At least you thought it was soft, which it probably is... I remember first seeing the Proton with the payload A/C system on some long time ago and thinking "The russians build their fairings out of steel? Hardcore."

7 hours ago, Deutherius said:

At least you thought it was soft, which it probably is... I remember first seeing the Proton with the payload A/C system on some long time ago and thinking "The russians build their fairings out of steel? Hardcore."

Isn't aluminum composite lighter?

Yeah, it's the climate control system to protect the payload. It's mainly thermal blankets with a whole lot of pipes going in and out.

Edited March 16, 2016 by Nibb31
